extracted_metadata.title: Should Job Applicants Be Excited or Calm? The Role of Culture and Ideal Affect in Employment Settings
extracted_metadata.author: Lucy Zhang Bencharit, Yuen Wan Ho, Helene H. Fung, Dannii Y. Yeung, Nicole M. Stephens, Rainer Romero-Canyas, Jeanne L. Tsai
extracted_metadata.subject: Cultural differences in emotion in employment settings
extracted_metadata.summary: This article investigates how cultural differences in ideal affect influence the presentation of job applicants and the preferences of employers. The research finds that European Americans prefer applicants who express high arousal positive states, while Hong Kong Chinese prefer calmness during job applications. This difference in ideal affect impacts hiring decisions and the manner in which applicants present themselves.
